title: exploring biomimicry
description: This 2-hour workshop on biomimicry will address nature as inspiration for design and technological solutions. We will consider the biological and natural world, and work hands on to create quick prototypes using paper, pen, and some building materials, on topics that might include re-designing social networks, mapping urban spaces, and re-defining user interfaces.

title: Early version – From Story to Tech: a methodology project
description: Advanced, earlier date of my presentation on the 17th for those of you who wish to get ideas for your Camp projects a little sooner.

title: Field trip to Bitfoms Gallery and Eyebeam
description: We’re going to visit http://www.bitforms.com and http://www.eyebeam.org. Feel free to join us.

title: Shop Safety!
description: I’d like to RSVP for this time spot if possible but 5-6 would work too.  Thanks!

title: Flying Robots
description: There is a growing community interested in building flying autonomous robots.   We will go over the history of flying robots.  The current and future roles these robots will play in our society.

title: Aerial Photography of Fresh Kills Landfill
description: Fresh Kills is one of the most infamous landfills in the United States containing all of New York city’s waste for over 50 years.  Visible from space and as large as the Great Wall of China, Fresh Kills is a New York secret located in Staten Island and currently being converted into a public park over the next thirty years.  Join us for a field trip to this epic landscape to discover the final resting place of our trash and experiment with aerial photography using kites and large helium balloons.  WIth these grassroots mapping techniques, we can begin to develop a high resolution map of the landfill, investigate vegetation growth and begin to better understand what happens to the things we throw away.
